children.subject: this does not directly answer your question, but I know 184 tries to expand the class as much as possible.

history.content:
Computer graphics covers the fundamentals of "traditional" graphics: rasterization, geometry, rendering, and simulation. Computational photography focuses on image manipulations. Very broadly and making very sweeping generalizations, graphics covers image creation and comp photo covers image editing. 

Regarding the actual class itself, 184 is in C++ and 194-26 is in Python/Matlab. Both are mostly based on projects and depending on your personal tastes/skills you may find one class easier than the other. If you were to take both, I think you would find the second one easier, but I don't think they need to be taken in any particular order (nor do you have to take both if you don't want to). 

Happy to answer any other specific questions you might have about either of these!

children.subject: personally I would recommend 184 because computer graphic fundamentals can be very useful in CV.

For animation, definitely 184 is more relevant. For VR and CV I think on the surface 194-26 might be more relevant, but these are very broad fields and the fundamentals taught in 184 will probably be very helpful.

I'm curious about a few related areas (VR, animation, computer vision especially with applications to AI) that I have very little experience in but would love to explore more. I'm not sure I can take both 194-26 and 184 next semester, so between the two, does anyone know which is the most useful and representative for each of those areas?

I'm also looking at 280 but I'm not sure how easy it'll be for undergrads to enroll in that.

I never took 16B but Comp Photo uses things like signal processing and dimensionality reduction and maybe a few other things that I don’t remember 16A covering. That being said, I think it’s definitely possible to self teach those things in Comp Photo if you’re able and motivated!

I am interested in taking both, but I'm on the waitlist for 184 and I'm afraid that if it doesn't expand, I won't get to take either class. I haven't taken 16B yet so that's stopping me from taking 194-26. Is it super necessary to have 16B knowledge, or is the Lin. Alg. taught in 16A enough (if I have also taken 70, 170 as other mathematical courses)? If it's enough, I might consider taking 194-26 before 184, but I'm unsure whether this is a good idea...

history.content:
I was interested in taking 184 after looking into the course, and so now I'm currently on the waitlist for the class; however, I just saw that 194-26 opened up and the material there interests me too. Could someone elaborate on how different the two classes are and if I could only take one this semester, which I should take?

Thanks!
history.subject: 184 vs 194-026
